Description: Hexagonal glazed stonepaste tile with design in underglaze blue on white.
Production place: Made in: Syria (??? (made in Egypt or Syria))
Curator's comments: This is one of a panel of 15 tiles. The designs are imitations of Chinese blue and white and combine Chinese-inspired foliate with more Islamic motifs such as geometrical designs and bulbous ewers. The Chinese motifs have been absorbed and transformed into a delightful hybrid Chinese-Islamic style. Several groups of such tiles are known, including those in situ in the mosque of Murad II in Edirne (north western Turkey)
Funder name: Funded by: Brooke Sewell Permanent Fund
